Glaiza off to a good start |author=Jerry Donato|publisher=[[The Philippine Star]]|date=December 1, 2007|accessdate=November 15, 2009 }}</ref>

â
[[File:Kaputol-ng-isang-awit.jpg|thumb|alt=On a dark green background with a white lyric sheet are two couples of one boy and one girl each on either side of yellow text which reads "Sine Novela presents: Kaputol Ng Isang Awit". | Logo for ''Kaputol ng Isang Awit'', featuring (left-right): [[Jolo Revilla]], [[Lovi Poe]], Glaiza de Castro and Marky Cielo.]]
+
In 2008, she achieved further recognition when she played the lead role in the television adaptation of the 1991 film, ''[[Kaputol ng Isang Awit]]''; she was given the role after veteran actress [[Jolina Magdangal]] turned down the role in favor of a hosting job on ''[[Pinoy Idol]]''.<ref name="PEP.ph">{{cite web |http://www.pep.ph/news/16348/Jolina-Magdangal-picks-Pinoy-Idol-over-Kaputol-Ng-Isang-Awit |title=
In 2008, she achieved further recognition when she played the lead role in the television adaptation of the 1991 film, ''[[Kaputol ng Isang Awit]]''; she was given the role after veteran actress [[Jolina Magdangal]] turned down the role in favor of a hosting job on ''[[Pinoy Idol]]''.<ref name="PEP.ph">{{cite web |http://www.pep.ph/news/16348/Jolina-Magdangal-picks-Pinoy-Idol-over-Kaputol-Ng-Isang-Awit |title=
Jolina Magdangal pics 'Pinoy Idol over 'Kaputol ng Isang Awit' |author=Nora Calderon|accessdate=November 15, 2009 }}</ref> In the series, de Castro played Sarah Monteza (played by actress [[Sharon Cuneta]] in the film), a poor girl with a good voice but low self-esteem. de Castro herself would later go on to say that the role was her "biggest break" thus far.<ref>{{tl icon}} {{cite web |url=http://www.pep.ph/news/16346/Glaiza-de-Castro-considers-Kaputol-Ng-Isang-Awit-a-make-or-break-project |title=Glaiza de Castro considers Kaputol ng Isang Awit a make-or-break project|author=Rose Garcia|publisher=Philippine Entertainment Portal|date=February 9, 2008|accessdate=November 29, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pep.ph/news/16636/TV-Ratings-(March-3-6):-Kaputol-ng-Isang-Awit-debuts-impressively|title="Kaputol ng Isang Awit" debuts impressively|author=Bong Godinez|publisher=Philippine Entertainment Portal|date=March 7, 2008|accessdate=November 30, 2009}}</ref>
Jolina Magdangal pics 'Pinoy Idol over 'Kaputol ng Isang Awit' |author=Nora Calderon|accessdate=November 15, 2009 }}</ref> In the series, de Castro played Sarah Monteza (played by actress [[Sharon Cuneta]] in the film), a poor girl with a good voice but low self-esteem. de Castro herself would later go on to say that the role was her "biggest break" thus far.<ref>{{tl icon}} {{cite web |url=http://www.pep.ph/news/16346/Glaiza-de-Castro-considers-Kaputol-Ng-Isang-Awit-a-make-or-break-project |title=Glaiza de Castro considers Kaputol ng Isang Awit a make-or-break project|author=Rose Garcia|publisher=Philippine Entertainment Portal|date=February 9, 2008|accessdate=November 29, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pep.ph/news/16636/TV-Ratings-(March-3-6):-Kaputol-ng-Isang-Awit-debuts-impressively|title="Kaputol ng Isang Awit" debuts impressively|author=Bong Godinez|publisher=Philippine Entertainment Portal|date=March 7, 2008|accessdate=November 30, 2009}}</ref>
Line 55: Line 55:
After another supporting role in the television adaptation of comic-book writer [[Carlo J. Caparas]]' graphic novel ''[[Gagambino]]'', de Castro once again landed a lead role on another television adaptation of a Filipino film, ''[[Kung Aagawin Mo Ang Lahat Sa Akin]]'' opposite [[Patrick Garcia]], [[Maxene Magalona]], [[Jackie Rice]] and [[JC Tiuseco]]. In the series she played the primary antagonist, Gladys Andrada (a role originated by co-star [[Jackie Lou Blanco]]), the jealous, only biological child of Gilbert (played by [[Nonie Buencamino]]) and Clara Andrada (played by Blanco). Her portrayal was well-received; columnist Jason John Lim commented that while she knew she was breaking out of her comfort zone, "What she didn't know that she would also begin breaking the expectations of everybody."<ref name="GMA News.tv">{{cite web |url=http://www8.gmanews.tv/story/170657/igma-glaiza-de-castro-gets-reborn-on-stairway-to-heaven |title=
After another supporting role in the television adaptation of comic-book writer [[Carlo J. Caparas]]' graphic novel ''[[Gagambino]]'', de Castro once again landed a lead role on another television adaptation of a Filipino film, ''[[Kung Aagawin Mo Ang Lahat Sa Akin]]'' opposite [[Patrick Garcia]], [[Maxene Magalona]], [[Jackie Rice]] and [[JC Tiuseco]]. In the series she played the primary antagonist, Gladys Andrada (a role originated by co-star [[Jackie Lou Blanco]]), the jealous, only biological child of Gilbert (played by [[Nonie Buencamino]]) and Clara Andrada (played by Blanco). Her portrayal was well-received; columnist Jason John Lim commented that while she knew she was breaking out of her comfort zone, "What she didn't know that she would also begin breaking the expectations of everybody."<ref name="GMA News.tv">{{cite web |url=http://www8.gmanews.tv/story/170657/igma-glaiza-de-castro-gets-reborn-on-stairway-to-heaven |title=
iGMA: Glaiza de Castro gets reborn on ''Stairway to Heaven'' |author=Jason John S. Lim|publisher=GMANews.tv|date=August 25, 2009|accessdate=November 15, 2009 }}</ref>
iGMA: Glaiza de Castro gets reborn on ''Stairway to Heaven'' |author=Jason John S. Lim|publisher=GMANews.tv|date=August 25, 2009|accessdate=November 15, 2009 }}</ref>
â
[[File:Kung-aagawin.jpg|thumb|left|Logo for ''Kung Aagawin Mo Ang Lahat Sa Akin'', with (l-r): Maxene Magalona, Patrick Garcia, de Castro and JC Tiuseco.|alt=A girl in green, a boy in fuchsia, a girl in brown and a boy in blue on an ornate teal background, with the words "Sine Novela Presents: Kung Aagawin Mo Ang Lahat Sa Akin" superimposed on the left.]]
+
Right after ''[[Kung Aagawin Mo Ang Lahat Sa Akin]]'', she played another supporting role on an episode of the drama anthology [[SRO Cinemaserye]], which chronicled the life story of singer [[Eva Castillo]] (portrayed in this episode by [[Manilyn Reynes]]).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/articles/213362/the-eva-castillo-story-continues-tonight|title='The Eva Castillo Story' continues tonight|author=Crispina Martinez Belen|publisher=[[Manila Bulletin]]|date=July 29, 2009|accessdate=December 13, 2009}}</ref> Shortly thereafter, she landed another role as the primary antagonist in the Philippine remake of the widely-popular [[Korean wave|Korean]] television drama, ''[[Stairway to Heaven (TV series)|Stairway to Heaven]]'', alongside [[Dingdong Dantes]], [[Rhian Ramos]] and [[TJ Trinidad]]. She portrayed Eunice Manansala (serving as the counterpart for Han Yoori, played by actress [[Kim Tae-hee]]), the envious stepsister of Jodi Reyes (played by Rhian Ramos). To prepare for the role, de Castro watched the original series in order to attempt to get an idea of who her character was as a person.<ref name="GMA News.tv"/> de Castro also commented on the relative complexity of her character in this series compared to her character in ''Kung Aagawin Mo Ang Lahat Sa Akin'': "Unlike my previous role, you donât know what is going on inside the mind of Eunice. Whatâs going inside her head is really devious. She is subtle in her approach and very scheming... Despite being evil, she still has a heart and thereâs a reason she became a bad person. If she is stepping down on people, she is also being stepped on by other people. She also has to fulfill her needs and wants and she will do everything for the person she loves."<ref name="MB.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.mb.com.ph/node/221714/glaiza-de-ca|title=
Right after ''[[Kung Aagawin Mo Ang Lahat Sa Akin]]'', she played another supporting role on an episode of the drama anthology [[SRO Cinemaserye]], which chronicled the life story of singer [[Eva Castillo]] (portrayed in this episode by [[Manilyn Reynes]]).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/articles/213362/the-eva-castillo-story-continues-tonight|title='The Eva Castillo Story' continues tonight|author=Crispina Martinez Belen|publisher=[[Manila Bulletin]]|date=July 29, 2009|accessdate=December 13, 2009}}</ref> Shortly thereafter, she landed another role as the primary antagonist in the Philippine remake of the widely-popular [[Korean wave|Korean]] television drama, ''[[Stairway to Heaven (TV series)|Stairway to Heaven]]'', alongside [[Dingdong Dantes]], [[Rhian Ramos]] and [[TJ Trinidad]]. She portrayed Eunice Manansala (serving as the counterpart for Han Yoori, played by actress [[Kim Tae-hee]]), the envious stepsister of Jodi Reyes (played by Rhian Ramos). To prepare for the role, de Castro watched the original series in order to attempt to get an idea of who her character was as a person.<ref name="GMA News.tv"/> de Castro also commented on the relative complexity of her character in this series compared to her character in ''Kung Aagawin Mo Ang Lahat Sa Akin'': "Unlike my previous role, you donât know what is going on inside the mind of Eunice. Whatâs going inside her head is really devious. She is subtle in her approach and very scheming... Despite being evil, she still has a heart and thereâs a reason she became a bad person. If she is stepping down on people, she is also being stepped on by other people. She also has to fulfill her needs and wants and she will do everything for the person she loves."<ref name="MB.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.mb.com.ph/node/221714/glaiza-de-ca|title=
Glaiza de Castro: "I'm not in love, yet" |author=Walden Sadiri|publisher=[[Manila Bulletin]]|date=September 22, 2009|accessdate=November 15, 2009 }}</ref> As with her two previous major roles, her portrayal was also well-received by critics; Jerry Donato of ''[[The Philippine Star]]'', in particular, has gone so far to say that "So far, Glaiza has given her Korean counterpart a run for her money."<ref name="Philstar.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=519604&publicationSubCategoryId=70|title=
Glaiza de Castro: "I'm not in love, yet" |author=Walden Sadiri|publisher=[[Manila Bulletin]]|date=September 22, 2009|accessdate=November 15, 2009 }}</ref> As with her two previous major roles, her portrayal was also well-received by critics; Jerry Donato of ''[[The Philippine Star]]'', in particular, has gone so far to say that "So far, Glaiza has given her Korean counterpart a run for her money."<ref name="Philstar.com">{{cite web |url=http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=519604&publicationSubCategoryId=70|title=
